# conductorone_access_profile_requestable_entry (Resource)

AccessProfileRequestableEntry Resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "conductorone_access_profile_requestable_entry" "my_access_profile_requestable_entry" {
  app_id          = "...my_app_id..."
  catalog_id      = "...my_catalog_id..."
  create_requests = false
  entitlement_id  = "...my_entitlement_id..."
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `app_id` (String) Requires replacement if changed.
- `catalog_id` (String) Requires replacement if changed.
- `entitlement_id` (String) Requires replacement if changed.

### Optional

- `create_requests` (Boolean) Whether or not to create requests for newly added entitlement for users in the catalog.
 By default, this is false and no requests are created.
Requires replacement if changed.

### Read-Only

- `requestable_entry` (Attributes) A requestable entry in a catalog (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--requestable_entry))

<a id="nestedatt--requestable_entry"></a>
### Nested Schema for `requestable_entry`

Read-Only:

- `app_id` (String) The ID of the app that contains the entitlement
- `catalog_id` (String) The ID of the access profile (catalog)
- `entitlement_id` (String) The ID of the entitlement

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

In Terraform v1.5.0 and later, the [`import` block](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) can be used with the `id` attribute, for example:

```terraform
import {
  to = conductorone_access_profile_requestable_entry.my_conductorone_access_profile_requestable_entry
  id = jsonencode({
    app_id         = "..."
    catalog_id     = "..."
    entitlement_id = "..."
  })
}
```

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import conductorone_access_profile_requestable_entry.my_conductorone_access_profile_requestable_entry '{"app_id": "...", "catalog_id": "...", "entitlement_id": "..."}'
```
